snippet: MELUM--Jerald Helmer (Jerry), died March 17, 2016 in Fort Myers, Florida. He was born November 15, 1919 in Oak Park, IL to Helmer and Henrietta (Nettie) Melum. He was predeceased by his wife, Shirley, and brother Herman William (Bill). He is survived by three daughters: Sheila Whitney, Melissa Melum, and Deborah McBee; three grandchildren: Kenneth Whitney, Alexander Whitney, and Alice McBee; and one great- granddaughter: Elsa Whitney. Mr. Melum graduated from The Hill School and Stanford University. He served in the U.S. Navy from 1942-1946. After duty afloat, he was a lieutenant in the Public Information Section on the staff of Admiral C. W. Nimitz, receiving a commendation for meritorious conduct. He worked in advertising account management in Chicago and New York, and on April 23, 1949 married Shirley Foote, widow of Robert W. Small in Bellport, NY. He later joined Time, Inc. where he became Corporate Sales Manager for Life Magazine. Subsequently he co-founded the Long Island business magazine "On The Sound" and ended his career as Assistant to the President of C.W. Post Center of Long Island University. He and Shirley retired to Sanibel Island, FL in 1983. A master of the "Long Island Railroad commuter fold," Mr. Melum was a lifelong reader of The New York Times. Even as his mental functioning declined in the last weeks of life, he derived comfort from having "the Times" tucked next to him in his wheelchair. Memorial donations may be made to Sanibel Captiva Conservation Foundation, P.O. Box 839, Sanibel, FL 33957. 1/3
